bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, November 29, 1952

div1.p: Lawrence Reed informs Hench that he has received three invitations from the Cuban government to attend the dedication of Camp Lazear. However, he has declined the invitations. He hopes that Hench has a wonderful time in Havana.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, November 29, 1952
div1.opener:
Major General Walter Lawrence Reed
2810 Thirty Sixth Place
Washington, D. C.
Nov. 29th -'52
My dear Dr Hench-
div1.p:
Replying to your letter of Nov-
20th enclosing your to Blossom- I am enclosing
a letter to you as per your Suggestion-

I received 3 separate invitations
to attend the ceremony-

The first from “El Ministro de
Sulabridad y Asistencia Social” signed by
Enrique Saladrigas Layas- I wrote to him
immediately & told him how deeply I regretted
my inability to attend- I do not know whether
he got my letter or not - because a week
later I got another invitation from “El
Presidente de la Republica” (I'm quoting the
first line only) signed by by 4 persons
Enrique Saladrigas Layas being the second
name thereon- I did not reply to this, because
I had already sent my regrets.

Yesterday the 29 Nov- I received a
Cablegram from Havana, quote “Nombre
AC
R
Presidente Republica General Batista etc” I did
not reply because it too, was signed “Dr Enrique
Saladrigas” without the Layas- & because of
these 3 separate invitations would you if you
have the oportunity & time to explain why I
answered the first one only-

I found out from Dr Siler that
General Strait was going down of on
Tuesday the second & he kindly said he would
late this letter to you I thought I might
have difficulty in addressing it in case of
the right person in Havana.

Hope you have a wonderful time
am truly sorry I could not return to Havana
after 50 years absence- I'll be 75 on the
4 of Dec
